alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Monroe; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 02 at 4:24AM EST until February 03 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 12 inches. * WHERE...Washtenaw, Lenawee, Monroe and Wayne Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain transitions to snow late this morning. Snow and falling temperatures will result in snow covered and slick roads. Peak snowfall occurs this afternoon with rates up to an inch per hour at times. Gusty north winds this afternoon and evening may lead to some blowing and drifting snow and poor visibilities. Snow rates drop off overnight with light snow continuing through Thursday. Rates may briefly increase to one half inch per hour Thursday afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
